section.title: Jmol v10 Beta Testing
section.p:
Jmol v10 is a complete rewrite of Jmol. Major features/changes include:
dramatic performance improvements
true 3d graphics engine that requires no special hardware
support for macromolecule secondary structure graphics
compatibility with existing RasMol/Chime scripts
JavaScript library to facilitate web application developement

p.i: Jmol version 10 will be released in December 2004. Please do your best to find and report bugs ... and have fun!

section.title: Bug reporting procedures
section.p: If you can, please submit bugs directly into the bug tracking database provided by sourceforge. This will save us a little time and, most importantly, will ensure that your bugs do not get lost.

section.title: Support and communications
section.p: During the test program, support will be provided through the jmol-users@lists.sf.net mailing list. If you are not on the list and would like to subscribe you can go to this page to subscribe

section.title: Release/distribution mechanism
section.p: Test releases will be made on this page. Releases will be a single .zip file that contains test prerelease. You can unzip this file using standard tools, including unzip, pkunzip, winzip, and jar. We do not plan to release sample files or support code. For those who are interested, source code is always available through anonymous CVS checkout.

section.title: Jmol10pre23
section.p:
Jmol version 10 pre-release 23 was released on Fri 10 Dec 2004.
Browsers with Java 1.4 can now pop up a command line console! The console can also be opened from a script using console [on|off]
Basic molecular model data can now be seen in the popup menu
Molecular model files can now be downloaded through the popup menu!
JmolAppletControl support was re-introduced
Jmol.js API change - jmolApplet no longer takes a molecular model file name. Load your file as part of the script
Support for frank and debugscript was dropped from applet param tags
CML files can now be read on 1.1 JVMs (Win32 && ((IE && MSFT JVM) || NS47)) using the Gnu Aelfred2 XML parser. Note that gnujaxp.jar must be explicitly included in the archive attribute string value
The load param tag to the applet is now deprecated. Users are encouraged to load their model file as part of their script
bug fixed - 'frank'/logo was sometimes not displayed
bug fixed - measured angle text was sometimes not displayed during rotation
bug fixed - hover text was sometimes not displayed when slab was on
bug fixed - moveTo went berzerk when model was already in the target orientation and the rotation angle was 0 degrees
bug fixed - when loading the JmolApplet with separate 'load' and 'script' params, the default style of the molecular model (spacefill 20%; wireframe 0.1; color cpk) was sometimes visible before your script executed

a.font: Give me the old code Jmol10pre22.zip

section.p: Unzip the code using the tool of your choice. It will unzip into a subdirectory of the current directory.
The Java jar tool will work fine since a .jar is the same format as .zip : jar xf Jmol10pre23.zip

To run the jmol application you can type: java -jar Jmol.jar
With most GUIs, you also be able to double-click on Jmol.jar to launch it. (If this doesn't work then create an association for files with the extension .jar)
